posts.name: Teddy
posts.cooked: Recent exploration of the Questnav Forum revealed a suggestion by @viggy96 to consider an Oak D camera paired with the Spectacular AI Tracking Suite as an alternative to Questnav—a topic I’ve been interested in for some time. After acquiring a new USB cable, I successfully implemented the AI tracking functionality on my Oak D Lite. However, initial results were inconsistent; the system exhibited occasional position jumps, sometimes drifting away, and struggled with accurate rotation when objects obstructed its view. These issues likely stem from configuration settings or the camera’s unofficial status. Moving forward, my focus will be on enhancing the visualization aspect rather than troubleshooting the camera setup further.

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked: I'd like to see this with another model that has a dot projector. I plan on getting one in the near future. That combined with a wider FOV for the tracking cameras should help.

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked: I expect this solution to offer a more compact design, simpler setup, and fewer moving parts compared to QuestNav. I have received the OAK-D Pro W.

posts.name: Teddy
posts.cooked: Slight update: Found a nice UI library that I should be able to set up fairly quickly so hopefully I will be able to post an initial prototype visualizer tomorrow.

posts.name: Teddy
posts.cooked: Progress has been made the testing UI is now semi-functional Its really janky since I wrote it in a morning under a time crunch but it mostly works Source code is available here https://github.com/dragonblade316/spectacle The end of the GIF confirms my suspicions that rotation messes up the position I don’t know why yet but I have a couple guesses More updates probably coming soon Also your Oak D Pro should work since it wasn’t designed for a specific oak model

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked:
Sure, here's the cleaned-up version of your text:

---

The text is:  
Do you know if the necessary Python packages for this can be installed on the roboRIO?  
Was thinking that in actual deployment, it would be nice if the "host" computer was the roboRIO itself.

---

posts.name: Teddy
posts.cooked: I put a list of Python dependencies on the GitHub README. Frankly, I think it would be rather unwise to try and install a package like this on the RoboIO. April Tag competition is already expensive enough, and while I haven’t benchmarked my tool, I doubt it is computationally cheap.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: That one guy obsessed with programming

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked: This isn't being offloaded onto the OAK-D, or maybe it won't be offloaded on the Lite.

posts.name: rahilm
posts.cooked: I’ve been looking into the OAK-D as well to experiment with, but it seems like they don’t recommend running any VSLAM processing on board with the current gen of products: VIO and SLAM. The next gen OAK 4 coming out soon (but above the FIRST Robotics Competition price limit) do seem to have enough compute to do it onboard.

posts.name: Teddy
posts.cooked: As far as I know, spectacular AI doesn’t offload to the oak. Additionally, the producer of the oak claims the current oaks aren’t powerful enough.

posts.name: Pedro Braga
posts.cooked: I wonder if infrared projectors would be legal, or even viable if this ever catches on. The system’s resistance to external interference isn’t something I fully understand, but with 2-3 robots in a match using them, I’d guess pose estimation could easily become unreliable for all involved.

link_counts.title: QuestNav: The Best Robot Pose Tracking System in FRC

posts.name: Teddy
posts.cooked:
More progress made! Notably, I fixed the rotation issue with my oak d lite by setting the imu_to_camera matrix, as it wasn't preset for this model. Oseiskar provided valuable guidance through their GitHub repository.

I've also been working on integrating apriltag support, though it crashes when detecting a tag during initialization. The crash appears linked to libc issues due to proprietary software, which complicates troubleshooting.

Once apriltag functionality is resolved, I plan to refocus my work on nt4 support and maintainability. My current setup will become obsolete with advantagescope, simplifying future endeavors.

If anyone knows the cause of the apriltag crashes, please share your insights.

posts.cooked: QuestNav uses the same approach (the Meta Quest has line projectors) but is unsure about the impact of widespread adoption of this technology in FIRST Robotics Competition.

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked: What does your AprilTag JSON look like?

posts.name: Teddy
posts.cooked: I made a tool to convert Limelight F-Map files to Spectacular AI Tags.json files on GitHub. Either way, the issue isn't resolved; the crash occurs when the tracking system starts rather than when the tags load.
